item.title: 1 - Introduction to Systematic Theology
item.description: Define systematic theology and discuss its relationship with other theological disciplines (historical theology, philosophical theology, apologetics, Old Testament theology, New Testament theology, and biblical theology).

item.title: 2 - The Authority and Inerrancy of the Bible
item.description: Defend the following statement: โAll the words in Scripture are Godโs words.โ ยง This is what the Bible claims for itself. OLD TESTAMENT In the Old Testament, the phrase โThus says the LORD,โ appears hundreds of times and was recognized as identical in form to the phrase, โThus says the Kingโ, which was used to preface the edict of a king to his subjects, an edict that could not be challenged or questioned, but that simply had to be obeyed.

item.title: 3 - The Clarity, Necessity, and Sufficiency of the Bible
item.description: Clarity of Scripture The clarity of Scripture means that the Bible is written in such a way that it is able to be understood, but right understanding requires time, effort, the use of ordinary means, a willingness to obey, and the help of the Holy Spirit; and our understanding will remain imperfect in this lifetime.

item.title: 4 - The Character of God โIncommunicableโ Attributes
item.description: Incommunicable Not able to be communicated to others/incapable of being communicated In addition to the Bible, what evidence do we have that God exists? ยง Two main ways: All people have an inner sense of God and evidence of God can be found in nature.

item.title: 5 - The โCommunicableโ Attributes of God
item.description: Name and differentiate between the two attributes that describe Godโs being. ยง Godโs Spirituality Godโs spirituality means that God exists as a being that is not made of any matter, has no parts or dimensions, is unable to be perceived by our bodily senses, and is more excellent than any other kind of existence.

item.title: 6 - The Trinity
item.description: Provide scriptural evidence for the doctrine of the Trinity from both the Old and New Testaments. ยง OLD TESTAMENT In Genesis 1:26, God said, โLet us make man in our Image, after our likeness.

item.title: 7 - Creation
item.description: Define the doctrine of creation. ยง Doctrine of Creation God created the entire universe out of nothing; it was originally very good; and he created it to glorify himself.

item.title: 8 - Godโs Providence
item.description: Godโs Providence God is continually involved with all created things in such a way that he keeps them existing and maintaining the properties with which he created them; cooperates with created things in every action, directing their distinctive properties to cause them to act as they do; and directs them to fulfill his purposes.

item.title: Bible Doctrine (Second Edition)
item.description: Info ยง Author: Wayne Grudem Publication Date: 05 April 2022 Pages: 672 Tags: #faith,#faith/doctrine Chapter 1: Introduction to Systematic Theology ยง PART 1: The Doctrine of the Word of God ยง Chapter 2: The Authority and Inerrancy of the Bible ยง Chapter 3: The Clarity, Necessity, and Sufficiency of the Bible ยง PART 2: The Doctrine of God ยง Chapter 4: The Character of God โIncommunicableโ Attributes ยง Chapter 5: The โCommunicableโ Attributes of God ยง Chapter 6: The Trinity ยง Chapter 7: Creation ยง Chapter 8: Godโs Providence ยง.
